scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You decided to help Mark with the urgent task despite being on leave. You've now finished the task and informed Mark about it. Later, [Monica] and [Bob] hear about this and have some thoughts. [Monica] comments, 'I can't believe you agreed to work on your leave, Alex. Don't you think you need to set better boundaries?' while [Bob] adds, 'Yeah, you're always the one stepping in. What if they start expecting it all the time?'. You explained your actions to Monica and Bob saying, 'I know, but sometimes exceptions have to be made. I just hope they don't take it for granted.' Monica raised an eyebrow and said, 'But where do you draw the line, Alex?' Bob nodded in agreement, adding, 'Yeah, you can't always be the go-to person.' You responded with, 'I get it, but I think it's important to be a team player. If it becomes too much, I'll deal with it then.' Monica crossed her arms and said, 'Alex, you need to think about your own well-being too.' Bob frowned and added, 'We're not saying don't help, but there's got to be a limit.' You replied, 'I hear you, but I think it's important to stay flexible. Every situation is different.' Now, Monica and Bob seem more concerned.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs heavily and says, 'Being flexible is one thing, but you also need to be fair to yourself, Alex.' [Bob] nods and adds, 'Exactly. We don't want you to burn out.'

options.text: I appreciate your concern. Maybe I should consider setting some firmer boundaries.
options.analysis: You acknowledged their concerns and showed empathy, but your motivation to stick to boundaries could be improved.

options.text: I get it, but I think we need to be adaptable. Each situation is unique and requires a different approach.
options.analysis: You showed good emotional perception and social skills by explaining your actions, but your self-regulation might need improvement.

options.text: I understand, but being a team player sometimes means making personal sacrifices. I'll manage it if it becomes too much.
options.analysis: You justified your decision and maintained good self-regulation, but showed less empathy towards the concern of setting boundaries.
